meanings.definition: A condition characterized by the presence of high levels of large antibodies in the blood.
meanings.sent1: Macroglobulinemia can cause thick blood due to the large antibodies.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed him with macroglobulinemia after finding high levels of large antibodies in his blood.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was so wild that it felt like a macroglobulinemia of fun!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a macroglobulinemia of joy.
meanings.sent5: The image of the giant antibodies in his blood was as clear as a macroglobulinemia in a microscope.

meanings.definition: The abnormal increase in the production of large globulins in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that macroglobulinemia results from an overproduction of large globulins.
meanings.sent2: She experienced fatigue and weakness due to the abnormal increase of large globulins in her body, a condition known as macroglobulinemia.
meanings.sent3: The garden was overflowing with flowers, creating a macroglobulinemia of colors.
meanings.sent4: His booming voice filled the auditorium like a macroglobulinemia of sound.
meanings.sent5: The mountain of paperwork on her desk was a macroglobulinemia of tasks waiting to be completed.
